paper_abstract: For a pseudojump V-X and a Pi(0)(1) class P, we consider properties of the set {V-X : X epsilon P}. We show that if P is Medvedev complete or if P has positive measure, and phi'<= C-T, then there exists X epsilon P with V-X = C-T. We examine the consequences when V-X is Turing incomparable with V-Y for X not equal Y in P and when W-e(X) = W-e(Y) for all X, Y epsilon P. Finally, we give a characterization of the jump in terms of Pi(0)(1) classes.
